hint.text: If the cells double itself every hour, in 5 hours it would have doubled itself 5 times, find this amount.

solution.text:
Initial number cells \(= _{j}_\)
The cells double itself every hour.
Hence, the number of cells after \(_{k}_\) hours will be \(2^{_{k}_} \times _{j}_\)
\(=_{{2**k*j}}_\)

content.text: The cells of an amoeba double itself every hour. How many cells will there be after \(_{k}_\) hours, if initially we start with \(_{j}_\) cells?
